skill.name: Backend Migrations
skill.description: Create and manage database schema migrations with reversibility, zero-downtime deployment support, and proper version control. Use this skill when creating database migration files, modifying schema, adding or removing tables/columns, creating indexes, managing migration rollbacks, or planning database changes. Apply when working with migration files, schema changes, database versioning, or any task involving evolving database structure over time while maintaining backwards compatibility and data integrity.

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill that provides guidance on database migration best practices. It contains no executable code, network calls, file system access, or other potentially dangerous capabilities. The skill is purely informational and instructs users on migration patterns and standards.

content.value_statement: Database schema changes often cause downtime and data loss. This skill guides you through creating reversible, zero-downtime migrations that maintain data integrity.
actual_capabilities: Guides creation of reversible database migrations
Advises on schema vs data migration separation
Suggests migration safety and reversibility checks
limitations: Requires manual implementation of migration code

use_cases.title: Safe Production Schema Updates
use_cases.description: Deploy schema changes to production databases without downtime or data loss using proven migration patterns.

use_cases.title: Migration Review and Validation
use_cases.description: Review migration files for safety, reversibility, and compliance with zero-downtime deployment standards.

use_cases.title: Schema Evolution Planning
use_cases.description: Plan complex schema refactorings while maintaining backwards compatibility and data integrity.

prompt_templates.title: Create Reversible Migration
prompt_templates.scenario: Adding a new column with safe defaults
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a reversible migration to add an email_verified boolean column to the users table with a safe default value of false and proper indexing.

prompt_templates.title: Zero-Downtime Deployment
prompt_templates.scenario: Renaming a column without breaking the app
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a multi-step migration strategy to rename the 'username' column to 'handle' in the users table with zero downtime.

prompt_templates.title: Migration Safety Check
prompt_templates.scenario: Reviewing a migration for production safety
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this migration for potential issues: [paste migration code]. Is it reversible? Could it cause downtime? Any data loss risks?

prompt_templates.title: Rollback Strategy
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a rollback migration for dropping the deprecated 'legacy_id' column from the products table, ensuring we can recover if needed.

output_examples.input: Create a migration to add a status column to orders table with safe defaults
output: 2. Up method: Adds status column with default 'pending' and NOT NULL constraint
3. Down method: Removes status column safely
4. Safety checks: Verify no existing NULL values, add index for queries
5. Deployment: Run in maintenance window or use online schema change tool

best_practices: Always create reversible migrations with proper up/down methods
Test migrations on a copy of production data before deployment
Separate schema changes from data migrations for clarity and safety
anti_patterns: Deploying untested migrations directly to production

faq.question: Which databases are supported?
faq.answer: The skill provides general patterns applicable to PostgreSQL, MySQL, SQLite, and most SQL databases.

faq.question: How do I handle large tables?
faq.answer: Use online schema change tools like pt-online-schema-change or built-in features like PostgreSQL's CONCURRENTLY for large tables.

faq.question: Can this integrate with my ORM?
faq.answer: Yes, the patterns work with ActiveRecord, Sequelize, SQLAlchemy, and other ORMs that support migrations.

faq.question: Is my data safe during migrations?
faq.answer: The skill emphasizes reversible migrations and backup strategies to ensure data safety during schema changes.

faq.question: What if a migration fails?
faq.answer: Always have a rollback plan tested. The skill guides you through creating fail-safe migration strategies.

faq.question: How does this compare to migration generators?
faq.answer: This skill provides intelligent guidance beyond basic generators, focusing on safety, reversibility, and zero-downtime patterns.
